data.text: The hue of that portion of the visible spectrum lying between green and indigo, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 420 to 490 nanometers; any of a group of colors that may vary in lightness and saturation, whose hue is that of a clear daytime sky; one of the additive or light primaries; one of the psychological primary hues.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A pigment or dye imparting this hue.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A person who wears a blue uniform.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A dress blue uniform, especially that of the US Army.
